title: [Neuroscience] Scientists have found higher levels of dietary fiber, particularly soluble fiber, are associated with a lower risk of dementia. Soluble fibers, found in foods such as oats and legumes, are important for the beneficial bacteria that live in the gut as well as providing other health benefits

[Health] UK Biobank study (N=400,000) finds that most, if not all, of the association between vegetable intake and reduced cardiovascular disease risk is actually just attributable to residual confounding, casting doubt on nutrition guidelines
